info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 29 at 3:30AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...RAIN MIXING WITH OR CHANGING TO SNOW THIS MORNING... An area of light to moderate precipitation will move across the Charleston Tri-County area early this morning as a developing nor`easter offshore pulls away from the region. Rain is expected to mix with or change to snow through daybreak as temperatures drop to near freezing. The chances for measurable snowfall will generally be highest along and north of Interstate 26, which includes portions of the Charleston Metro Area. Anywhere from a trace or a dusting to as much as 1/2 inch will be possible through sunrise. While significant snow accumulations are unlikely at this time, a few slick spots could develop overnight on area roadways. Use caution if traveling tonight into Saturday morning. If you observe snow, please let the National Weather Service know by calling 888-383-2024 or you can email the report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov
info.instruction: If you plan to drive or walk, remain alert for slick spots on paved surfaces. Slow your driving speed and use care when walking on sidewalks, driveways or parking lots. Slips and falls constitute a leading cause of injuries during winter weather.
